description: Granger +â€Ž -ize, after James Granger, an 18th-century English biographer. Granger's Biographical History of England (1769) included areas for readers to illustrate the pages.

verbs.description: grangerize (third-person singular simple present grangerizes, present participle grangerizing, simple past and past participle grangerized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To illustrate (a book) with material such as images taken from other published sources, such as by clipping them out for one's own use.
(transitive) To illustrate with material taken from published sources.
(transitive) To remove material, especially images, from a publication.
